page.title: 17 WAVERLEY ABBEY
page.content: Tha Abbey was founded in 1128 by Abbot John and 12 monks from Aumone,near Chartres,on land near the River Wey given by the Bishop of Winchester. Waverley was the first Cistercian monastery in England and it became the largest and most influential house of the Order.The White monks used to walk into the town by Abbey Street_today this is a cul-de-sac. In 1536 the Abbey's life was suppressed with the dissolution of monasteries and the buildings fell into disrepair.The stone of Waverley became a convenient source of building material in the area. Excavations were carried out at the turn of the century and in recent years the Abbey has been administered by The Department of Environment.
